Jean Baptiste MINANI

Software Engineering Research Scientist
I am a software researcher specializing in IoT systems testing and various software engineering aspects, with over 10 years of industry experience in quality assurance and testing, system design and development, enterprise architecture, requirements analysis, and project management. My research focuses on developing automated, functional testing solutions for complex systems such as IoT and embedded systems. Currently completing a PhD in Software Engineering at Concordia University, Quebec, CA. I am exploring different approaches for generating and executing tests, using Large Language Model (LLM) and Natural Language Processing (NLP) techniques to automate test generation from use case specifications.

Previously, I earned a Master’s degree in Information Technology from Carnegie Mellon University , where I gained hands-on experience in designing and devloping embedded systems. During my studies, I worked on a Body Area Network for wireless sensors, and we proposed a prototype for remote patient monitoring in healthcare and IoT sensor networks while working with BOSCH LLC. I also worked with Palo Alto Networks to develop network monitoring tool as system engineer intern. My Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology from Vellore Institute of Technology majoring in software engineering.

In industry, I have led multiple high-impact software projects, including government automation platforms such as the SmartAdmi and Smart Prosecution Systems in Rwanda. As a team leader, I directed large-scale implementations of various e-government solutions, including document tracking, workflow management, and judicial case management systems, which have been instrumental in enhancing process efficiencies within public sector institutions. Additionally, I played a key role in building and architecting Rwanda's Government Command Center dashboard, a platform used by officials to monitor sector performance.

I have also contributed as a part-time lecturer and instructor at institutions such as the University of Rwanda and regular instructor for various courses at Adventist University of Central Africa – AUCA. I served as teaching assistant at Concordia University and at Carnegie Mellon University Africa – CMU for both undergraduate and graduate courses.

My published work includes various studies on testing, quality assurance are published in journals such IEEE IoT, TSE, JSS, and IST.

I hold certifications as an Oracle Certified Java Professional, Microsoft Certified Technology Specialist, and TOGAF-certified enterprise architect.
